content:
• Thursday, July 19, 2012
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) has resumed trading, currently changing hands at $35, -19% in the...

    Cepheid (NASDAQ:CPHD) has resumed trading, currently changing hands at $35, -19% in the post-session.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 PM
  • EQIX

    Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) +2% AH after Nomura starts coverage with a Buy and $210 PT. It declares...

    Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) +2% AH after Nomura starts coverage with a Buy and $210 PT. It declares Equinix to have "the most attractive carrier-neutral data center assets," and predicts the company will continue taking share thanks to its scale and service depth. Nomura also argues Equinix's business model (leasing data center co-location space) makes it relatively recession-proof. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • GORO

    Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) -2.8% AH after reporting lower than expected Q2 production of...

    Gold Resource (NYSEMKT:GORO) -2.8% AH after reporting lower than expected Q2 production of ~14,500 oz. precious metal gold equivalent at a 60:1 price ratio. GORO revises its 2012 outlook by ~15% to a targeted annual production range of 100K-120K oz. equivalent at a 53:1 price ratio. Development of the Arista mine will determine whether targets will be achieved in 2013-14.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q2 earnings call for Q3 revenue of $1.15B-$1.25B - largely below a...

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q2 earnings call for Q3 revenue of $1.15B-$1.25B - largely below a consensus of $1.22B, but better than many feared in light of weak NAND flash memory prices. A gross margin of 26%-30% is expected, close to Q2's 28.3%, as cost reductions offset price declines. SNDK +12.4% AH. MU +3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • STAA

    STAAR Surgical (NASDAQ:STAA) says in its preliminary Q2 report that revenue will be below...

    STAAR Surgical (NASDAQ:STAA) says in its preliminary Q2 report that revenue will be below expectations. It now anticipates revenue to come in at $16M, versus Street estimates of $18.3M. The company blames lower than expected Visian ICL sales in its Asia Pacific and European regions for the shortfall. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • NCR

    NCR (NYSE:NCR): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.41B (+10.8% Y/Y) misses by $60M....

    NCR (NYSE:NCR): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.41B (+10.8% Y/Y) misses by $60M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • BLDR

    Builders FirstSource (NASDAQ:BLDR): Q2 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $271.9M (+31.7%...

    Builders FirstSource (NASDAQ:BLDR): Q2 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $271.9M (+31.7% Y/Y) beats by $27M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q2 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.78B (-10.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q2 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.78B (-10.3% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD's Q2: Results largely in-line with lowered guidance. The chipmaker expects Q3 growth...

    More on AMD's Q2: Results largely in-line with lowered guidance. The chipmaker expects Q3 growth of -4% to +2% Q/Q, below Street expectations of +6%, and Intel's guidance for 2%-10% growth. CPU division sales -13% Q/Q, primarily due to a lower ASP. Graphics division -5% with a flat ASP. Gross margin was flat Q/Q at 46%, expected to fall to 44% in Q3. Inventories rose $248M Q/Q to $833M due to lower sales. AMD -3.1% AH. (PR) (CFO comments - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • CYT

    Cytec Industries (NYSE:CYT): Q2 EPS of $1.55 may not be comparable to consensus of $1.20. Shares...

    Cytec Industries (NYSE:CYT): Q2 EPS of $1.55 may not be comparable to consensus of $1.20. Shares +1.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • BMI

    Badger Meter (NYSE:BMI): Q2 EPS of $0.52 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $81.9M (+9.1% Y/Y). Shares...

    Badger Meter (NYSE:BMI): Q2 EPS of $0.52 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $81.9M (+9.1% Y/Y). Shares -6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • KNX

    Swift Transportation (SWFT): Q2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $872.6M (+2.6% Y/Y)....

    Swift Transportation (SWFT): Q2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $872.6M (+2.6% Y/Y). Shares +6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (NYSE:SXC) +7.8% AH after its board approves the formation of a master limited...

    SunCoke Energy (NYSE:SXC) +7.8% AH after its board approves the formation of a master limited partnership. Key assets of the MLP are expected to be a portion of SXC's interests in its Haverhill and Middletown cokemaking facilities in Ohio.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL): Q2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.03B (-15.9%...

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL): Q2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.03B (-15.9% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $230.6M (+30.4% Y/Y)...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $230.6M (+30.4% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    More on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Comparable restaurant sales +8% Y/Y vs. 10.1% expected. Operating...

    More on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Comparable restaurant sales +8% Y/Y vs. 10.1% expected. Operating margin 28.3%, +280 bps. 55 restaurants opened during Q2, bringing total count to 1,316. Full-year outlook: Mid-single digit comparable restaurant sales growth and 155-165 new store openings. Conference call at 4:30 ET. Shares -7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • BGS

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $148.6M (+14.8% Y/Y)....

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $148.6M (+14.8% Y/Y). Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATHN

    athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN): Q2 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $103.5M (+32.9% Y/Y)...

    athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN): Q2 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $103.5M (+32.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q2 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.41B (-10%...

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q2 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.41B (-10% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ACTG

    Acacia Research (NASDAQ:ACTG): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $50.4M (+27% Y/Y)....

    Acacia Research (NASDAQ:ACTG): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $50.4M (+27% Y/Y). Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)

  • ALGN

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q2 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $145.6M (+21.3% Y/Y)...

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q2 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $145.6M (+21.3% Y/Y) beats by $2.6M. Shares -7.9% AH. (PR)

  • CMG

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Q2 EPS of $2.56 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $690.9M (+20.9% Y/Y) misses by...

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Q2 EPS of $2.56 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $690.9M (+20.9% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares -6.5% AH (PR)

  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.03B (-25% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.03B (-25% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q2 EPS of $10.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $8.36B (+21% Y/Y) misses by...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q2 EPS of $10.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $8.36B (+21% Y/Y) misses by $50M. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 7 Comments
  • TSM

    TSMC (TSM -2.3%) closes lower after missing Q2 estimates. As the world's biggest chip foundry,...

    TSMC (TSM -2.3%) closes lower after missing Q2 estimates. As the world's biggest chip foundry, TSMC's performance can shed a light on broader chip demand. The company is guiding for Q3 sales to grow 6%-8% Q/Q, largely in-line with estimates, but also cautions distributor and customer inventories are high, with the former expected to reach 12 days above seasonality by the end of Q3. An inventory correction is expected in Q4, though TSMC is still guiding for above-seasonal performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (JCI -8.2%) shares plunge after the car battery maker missed its FQ3 earnings...

    Johnson Controls (JCI -8.2%) shares plunge after the car battery maker missed its FQ3 earnings target. While Europe's auto production cutbacks have been a concern, JCI also noted prices for spent battery cores surged to all-time highs last quarter. While cutting its FQ4 outlook, JCI doesn't expect the combination of soft demand and higher input costs to continue into next fiscal year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LH

    Medical testing stocks slump after both Lab Corp.(LH -5.8%) and Quest Diagnostics (DGX -3.3%)...

    Medical testing stocks slump after both Lab Corp.(LH -5.8%) and Quest Diagnostics (DGX -3.3%) posted weak Q2 revenue and lowered their top-line targets for the year: Radnet (RDNT -0.5%) CardioNet (BEAT -1.5%), Alliance HealthCare Services (AIQ-OLD -5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • CORN

    Interesting action in the Chicago pits today, where old crop (Sept) corn soared another $0.18 to...

    Interesting action in the Chicago pits today, where old crop (Sept) corn soared another $0.18 to a record $8.13, but new crop (Dec, March) fell, the spread between the two shooting higher late in the session. The divergence suggests at least some optimism for a reasonable crop to come in, no? CORN -2.3% as the action in the new crop months overwhelmed the record price move.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • JPM

    Technicians call it filling the gap, but whatever it is, it's not pretty. JPMorgan (JPM -1.8%)...

    Technicians call it filling the gap, but whatever it is, it's not pretty. JPMorgan (JPM -1.8%) gives up just about all of a 6% surge following its earnings report last Friday. The bank is clearly well-capitalized and the CIO loss but a blip, but in a slow-economy, flattish yield curve environment, where will underlying earnings growth come from?

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +6.1%) gives back some of its premarket gains as the Street digests its mixed Q2...

    Nokia (NOK +6.1%) gives back some of its premarket gains as the Street digests its mixed Q2 data.Nokia's pre-subsidy Lumia ASP fell 15% Q/Q to €186 ($227), as it cuts prices to stoke demand. North American Lumia shipments only totaled 600K, in spite of AT&T's promotions. MKM remains bearish, asserting Nokia's €4.2B in net cash could be gone in 2 years. Q4/Q1 could be make-or-break time for Nokia, as it rolls out Windows Phone 8 models featuring its PureView camera tech.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceutical (ISIS -8%) is getting pasted today after Jefferies Analyst Eun Yang cut the...

    Isis Pharmaceutical (ISIS -8%) is getting pasted today after Jefferies Analyst Eun Yang cut the shares two notches, from Buy to Underperform. Yang says that all the good news is already priced into the stock and the the downside risk, especially from launch delays or disappointing sales, becomes heightened at these levels. It's hard to argue with that logic, considering that the stock has nearly doubled since mid-April.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 2 Comments

  • Oil rises for a 7th straight day, jumping 3.1% to $92.69, the highest level since mid-May....

    Oil rises for a 7th straight day, jumping 3.1% to $92.69, the highest level since mid-May. Tensions across the Middle East are as good an excuse as any, with Israeli authorities blaming Iran for the deadly bombing of a tour bus in Bulgaria. There's also Syria spiraling downward.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -6.9%) dives after announcing it will move its corporate HQ from Prague to...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -6.9%) dives after announcing it will move its corporate HQ from Prague to New York City, and and will de-list from the Prague exchange. KIT will continue to maintain R&D facilities in Prague. The move follows extensive management and board changes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -3.5%) sells off after BTIG, which is quite bearish on the Internet radio leader,...

    Pandora (P -3.5%) sells off after BTIG, which is quite bearish on the Internet radio leader, expresses concerns about the impact of iOS 6 on Pandora listening. The next update to Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) OS brings with it the ability to stream songs made available through the $25/year iTunes Match service, rather than having to download them. But iTunes Match, which provides high-quality cloud copies of a user's music files, isn't a direct rival to Pandora.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • FCX

    "With all the negative comments about the world's economic situation, to have copper at $3.50...

    "With all the negative comments about the world's economic situation, to have copper at $3.50 (per pound) I think is notable," Freeport (FCX +4.6%) CEO Richard Adkerson exults and shares surge. Copper inventories "have dropped globally" even as economic growth has slowed; "Even in Europe, with weak economic demand, copper markets remain relatively tight." (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN +2.1%) return to earth since spiking higher earlier this morning after...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN +2.1%) return to earth since spiking higher earlier this morning after its marketing website inadvertently circulated a report that Amarin's AMR101, or Vascepa, will be approved. The company acknowledged the error, saying that says no determination on AMR101 NDA has yet been made by the FDA, adding that information on the site was outdated and should not be relied on.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • FFIV

    Down initially after providing soft FQ4 guidance to go with an in-line FQ3 report, F5 (FFIV...

    Down initially after providing soft FQ4 guidance to go with an in-line FQ3 report, F5 (FFIV +3.3%) has turned positive. Shares had fallen 30% from early May levels on widespread concerns about Euro demand, telecom capex, and soft IT spending in general. During its earnings call, F5 noted EMEA revenue grew a healthy 19% Y/Y in FQ3. Analysts are pleased with F5's strong sales to financial clients, but less so with the 10%+ Q/Q declines in telecom and tech sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • CY

    Cypress Semi (CY -2.6%) guides on its Q2 earnings call for Q3 EPS of $0.18 and Q/Q revenue...

    Cypress Semi (CY -2.6%) guides on its Q2 earnings call for Q3 EPS of $0.18 and Q/Q revenue growth of -2% to +2%, well below a consensus of $0.26 and 12% growth. But Cypress, which closed yesterday near its 52-week low thanks to worries about a weak demand outlook, is off only moderately. Rival touchscreen/touchpad controller vendors Atmel (ATML +1.6%) and Synaptics (SYNA +1.3%) are trading higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -9%) spike lower on a cautious report from Citron Research, noting the...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS -9%) spike lower on a cautious report from Citron Research, noting the situation is quite similar to that of Nitromed eight years ago. VVUS' intellectual property protection is "riddled with flaws," Citron says, and it's astounded by the lack of due diligence on the Street regarding the issue. TheStreet.com's Adam Feuerstein disagrees, however, saying there's nothing new in the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 15 Comments
  • BAC

    The 30 bp decline in Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) net interest margin represents $1.27B in lost...

    The 30 bp decline in Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) net interest margin represents $1.27B in lost quarterly earnings power, says Josh Steiner, a "hit (that) is recurring, not one time." This deterioration in bank's underlying business may help explain the sharp decline in the stock (-4% today, -4.8% yesterday) despite a headline beat on earnings thanks to a large reserve release.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 8 Comments
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -2.5%) reports Q2 average sales volumes of 12,696 boe/day, a 385%...

    Kodiak Oil &Gas (KOG -2.5%) reports Q2 average sales volumes of 12,696 boe/day, a 385% Y/Y increase and 20% Q/Q gain. KOG says it currently operates seven drilling rigs and participates in the drilling of two non-operated rigs in its Dunn County area of mutual interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI -6.4%) and America Movil (AMX -1.4%) slump after Brazil's telecom regulator...

    Telecom Italia (TI -6.4%) and America Movil (AMX -1.4%) slump after Brazil's telecom regulator suspends phone sales for the country's top 3 carriers in a number of states, citing poor service and complaints. Telecom Italia's TIM will be prohibited from selling phones in 19 states, and AMX's Claro will be prohibited in 3 states. Sales can only resume after the carriers present investment plans detailing how they will improve service.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google (GOOG +2.9%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report - eBay's results could be...

    Google (GOOG +2.9%) is rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q2 report - eBay's results could be helping, given much of Google's search ad revenue is tied to e-commerce activity. Search ad prices will be in focus, following two quarters of significant declines. Two wild cards that could work in Google's favor: mobile queries are soaring, and ad clicks are surging as a % of total search clicks, thanks to Google's efforts to promote them. Some are worried about Euro and forex exposure. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • CIEN

    If there's a theme to Q2 tech earnings reports so far, it's "good enough." Just as several...

    If there's a theme to Q2 tech earnings reports so far, it's "good enough." Just as several large-caps have rallied on so-so results, beaten-down telecom equipment and optical component names are rallying on Verizon's guidance for "flat to down" 2012 capex - some feared worse guidance in light of recent warnings. CIEN +5%. ALU +6.9%. JDSU +2%. FNSR +3%. JNPR +2.8%. Nomura sees Verizon's comments about 40G/100G optical investments as a positive for Juniper and Ciena.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko (APC -1.9%) shares slip after Bloomberg reports settlement talks with Tronox (TROX...

    Anadarko (APC -1.9%) shares slip after Bloomberg reports settlement talks with Tronox (TROX +1.4%) broke down, but UBS says the story is incorrect and discussions are continuing. Tronox claims APC transferred funds belonging to creditors out of TROX prior to the latter's 2009 bankruptcy filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • EBAY

    A modest Q2 beat and in-line guidance are enough to send eBay (EBAY +8.5%) to 6-year highs....

    A modest Q2 beat and in-line guidance are enough to send eBay (EBAY +8.5%) to 6-year highs. PayPal's performance is in focus, as is eBay's growing mobile presence: The company predicts both PayPal and Marketplaces will handle $10B in mobile transactions this year, above prior estimates of $7B and $8B. Needham is pleased with eBay's rising margins and strong merchandise volumes, and thinks guidance could be conservative. AMZN +3.1%. OSTK +2.3%. MELI +1.5%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • DO

    Diamond Offshore (DO +3.3%) shares rally after the company's better-than-expected quarterly...

    Diamond Offshore (DO +3.3%) shares rally after the company's better-than-expected quarterly profit, credited to a reduction in unanticipated rig downtime and cost control, and says the deepwater drilling market remains strong. DO strikes a deal for a deepwater unit under construction at a rate of $490K/day. Shares are upgraded to Add from Neutral at Capital One. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.2%) nears a 52-week high despite reporting quarterly...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.2%) nears a 52-week high despite reporting quarterly production at the lower end of its outlook range of 149K-154K boe/day, hurt by an unplanned shutdown of a processing facility run by third party. Natural gas liquids fractionation downtime hurt production by ~4,800 boe/day at its Spraberry field in Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • NVR

    Homebuilders are weak this morning on the back of less-than-stellar June Existing Home Sales...

    Homebuilders are weak this morning on the back of less-than-stellar June Existing Home Sales numbers and a disappointing quarter from NVR (NVR -10%): D.R. Horton (DHI -0.1%), MDC (MDC -1.3%), Lennar (LEN -0.7%), Hovanian (HOV -2.6%), Ryland (RYL -2.1%). ETFs: XHB -0.1%, ITB -2%, PKB -0.4%

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • VFC

    Shares of V.F. Corporation (VFC +6.8%) roar higher after the global apparel company knocks out a...

    Shares of V.F. Corporation (VFC +6.8%) roar higher after the global apparel company knocks out a profit beat with its Q2 report and raises its outlook for full-year earnings. The company says its wide diversity of brands allows it to weather the storm in Europe a bit better than peers. Sales gains at its outdoors sports-related segment offset a decline in its jeanswear segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • BHP

    Few expect volatility in BHP Billiton (BHP +2.4%) shares to end soon, as analysts continue to...

    Few expect volatility in BHP Billiton (BHP +2.4%) shares to end soon, as analysts continue to trim earnings forecasts for BHP and its peers. “The prospect of further declines in commodity prices on a weakening macro outlook is likely to limit near-term share price performance,” UBS wrote after BHP's production report. Citi sees capex cuts if commodities weaken further.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -2.1%) and rival Stratasys (SSYS -2.2%) sell off after JPMorgan downgrades the...

    3D Systems (DDD -2.1%) and rival Stratasys (SSYS -2.2%) sell off after JPMorgan downgrades the former to Underperform on valuation grounds. JPM notes DDD had risen 148% YTD, thanks in large part to enthusiasm about the long-term potential of 3D printing, and argues its current share price doesn't reflect near-term cyclical risks and Euro exposure (35% of sales).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • AOS

    Shares of A.O. Smith (AOS -2.2%) slip on a bout of profit taking after a number of Wall Street...

    Shares of A.O. Smith (AOS -2.2%) slip on a bout of profit taking after a number of Wall Street firms cut the shares on valuation following its solid Q2 earnings beat yesterday. The stock has been on a tear over the past few months, gaining nearly 20% since early June. Wedbush and Sterne Agee both downgrade the stock to Neutral, while KeyBanc reduces its rating to hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • FIVE

    Retailer Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) jumps higher after debuting on the Nasdaq today. After pricing...

    Retailer Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) jumps higher after debuting on the Nasdaq today. After pricing its IPO at $17, shares of the teenage-focused apparel seller are currently trading hands at $21.31 after spiking to as high as $28.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration (NFX +3.2%) hikes its production forecast for the second time this year,...

    Newfield Exploration (NFX +3.2%) hikes its production forecast for the second time this year, now expecting 2012 production of 296-304Bcfe, and sees capital spending of $1.7B for the year. NFX says it's planning to increase its activities in key oil regions and lease acreage in the Cana Woodford area in Oklahoma's Anadarko Basin.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems (MITK -13.1%) dives after announcing it's suing the USAA, an ex-customer, for...

    Mitek Systems (MITK -13.1%) dives after announcing it's suing the USAA, an ex-customer, for defamation and unfair business practices. Mitek points to an April PR from the USAA accusing Mitek of misappropriating confidential information and claiming it as its own. Mitek shares were crushed in April after the USAA filed a breach of contract and fraud suit against Mitek, and plunged again in May on an earnings miss. William Blair thinks Mitek will have to settle.

  • NE
